column4: i am dual booting mac os and windows. I can't afford to partition my system, as it will lead to a mess. Can i install ubuntu using Wubi without affecting mac os and windows installations?
i am dual booting mac os and windows. I can't afford to partition my system, as it will lead to a mess. Can i install ubuntu using Wubi without affecting mac os and windows installations?
i mean is it safe to tryout along with mac os boot?
am not having a mac!! its a dell
i had problems when i tried opensuse which created extra partitions
i had 3 trials for getting mac n windows to work together. But i miss my linux :(
i believe wubi only creates a file in c: drive and a boot entry.. So it should be safe, right?
correct
it will also be affected by fragmentation as the data is stored in NTFS
thank u :) i think i should try it.. wish me luck
its good as a quick try before youbuybut as a long term solution I recommend a true install
what version of windows are you running?
win 7
win7 can resize its partitions to make space which you can then install ubuntu to
not sure, we don't support illegal practises here
I'd check the mac license
as long as you resize the ntfs partition you will leave free space which can then be used for Ubuntu, it won't touch anything else
and I can read lowercase too, so don't bother with caps next time
hmm.. i am afraid of partitioning ;) so i guess i'll stich with wubi
your choice, ntfs will directly affect performance
thank u
